channel.title: World of warcraft's "peer to peer download"
channel.description:
hiya,
When downloading a world of warcraft update switch off peer to peer, its just a way for blizzard to save bandwidth and money i guess. As if they need it but it clearly states here -
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img235.imageshack.us/img235/6889/lllvi6.jpg[/img][/URL]
that peer 2 peer WILL increase your download speeds, hmm heres what results i got.
with peer 2 peer -
average download speed - 27kps time to download - flickering for 4-8 hours max speed - 134kps (once every few mins it would climb then fall)
without peer 2 peer -
average download speed - 160kps time to download - 1hour 24 mins max speed - 180kps if not more
is the info on the site wrong or am i wrong? please explain if anyone knows some more about this?

item.title: World of warcraft's "peer to peer download"
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

solemn wishes:

i 100 perc agree with you but why on there site say “you WIll experience slower download speeds”

if they say ‘we dont want you to use it, but you still can’
then everyone would start doing it, and blizzards host crashes

its like that tree that cured malaria, you got the sap and it healed you, it killed to tree as well, and whole forists of trees died because people were so desperate

Read full topic
item.source: World of warcraft's "peer to peer download"

item.title: World of warcraft's "peer to peer download"
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

So, you are a single person who is experiencing good speed without P2P.
Now, split that up between 60 million people, from a single host. The entire WoW site would be offline within seconds.

So, in essence it’s not a lie. You’re just an exception abusing the system. I’ve always had 150kb/s+ speeds from the Blizzard downloader, if it wasn’t already uploaded on ausgamers. It’s far more difficult than you can ever imagine to provide bandwidth for such an intensive/large game & site.

Read full topic
item.source: World of warcraft's "peer to peer download"
